content.description:
WTLH is a deep water solo that traverses the entire peninsula.

Starts on descent but sometimes slimey easy 5th. Short but exciting crux moves 2/3 of the way into traverse over a sea cave, then over a giant Chockstone!!!
content.location: Obvious large peninsula protruding from center of bay. Start on south side. Have fun. :)

content.description: Victory at Sea, is the chimney/off width that splits the largest boulder. Best at a minus tide during dryer conditions.
content.protection: High ball/free solo.  High tide makes for some fun mini DWS.
content.location: The obvious chimney/off width splitting the largest northern boulder. Just  west of Davie Jones.
Left of Monsters of the Deep on West side of same boulder.

content.description: Sit start on south side of over hung pockets. Fun moves over descent landing. Three variations!!!
content.location: One of the smaller but dryer boulders farthest east on south beach.

content.description:
This route follows the obvious large crystal dyke/fin that goes up the East side of Davey Jones Boulder.

Sharp jug fest.  Bad landing.
content.location:
East face of Davey Jones boulder. Follow the obviouse crystal line.

This is also the way down.

content.description: Start matching an undercling on the jug towards the bottom of the crack that runs through the middle of the boulder. Continue straight up the crack, then slightly to the right to finish.
content.protection: Since the boulder is low, one could conceivably fall carefully amongst the small rocks surrounding the boulder. Crash pad is extremely useful.
content.location: If you approach the 'whale tail' (rock formation in the center of the 2 beaches, dividing little harbor from shark harbor) from the little harbor side, traverse around until you reach the first large boulder. It is immediately in front of a cave. This would be the end of the route if you are completing the Welcome to Little Harbor traverse (you should).
